newsArray.title: Leading charity chief executive Tony Hume to run for WACA board on diversity and inclusion agenda
creator: Glen Quartermain
newsArray.description: The CEO of one of Australia‚Äôs leading children‚Äôs charities is running for the WACA board to embrace and protect the work of the WA Cricket Foundation.
newsArray.content: The CEO of one of Australia‚Äôs leading children‚Äôs charities is running for the WA Cricket board to support its progressive stance on diversity and inclusion. Tony Hume, who heads Variety, The Children‚Äôs Charity, says a healthy elite cricket program must underpin a strong community focused culture. He said he was an ‚Äúabsolute fan‚Äù of the WA Cricket Foundation. Justin Chadwick ‚ÄúI am of the belief that cricket is a great enabler of kids with disabilities, kids from tough socio-economic backgrounds,‚Äù Hume said. ‚ÄúI just want to make sure good governance is kept at the WACA and play my role and use my networks to assist where I can. ‚ÄúI am an absolute fan of what the foundation is doing and their inclusive approach.‚Äù Hume said the fact WA Cricket cleaned up last year, winning the men‚Äôs domestic Sheffield Shield and one-day titles as well as the BBL and WBBL crowns, was proof the organisation had the right leadership. ‚ÄúIt shows you can have these programs and give it a wider appeal in the community as well as ensuring the elite level is going extremely well,‚Äù he said. Hume‚Äôs nomination was supported by fashion designer and philanthropist Meredith McClements, who is a trustee on the WA Cricket Foundation. He said the $100 million WACA development would ensure the historic ground once again found its niche in WA‚Äôs sporting landcape. ‚ÄúTo be honest, I think all of us would prefer if we had the MCG in our back garden,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI got a bit sad towards the end of the WACA before the (Optus) stadium came along when we were only able to get about 15,000 people in when the Scorchers were absolutely flying. ‚ÄúWe had outgrown it. It is still a great ground and a great cricket ground but I think the sensible approach that is happening right now to get more of the community involved is the way to go., inclusive playgrounds, all these community facilities. ‚ÄúIt is never going to be a 100,000 seat stadium. ‚ÄúIt was a shut off place in the past with big fences around and you only went there if you were interested in the elite cricket. ‚ÄúWell this has opened it up to a far wider audience.‚Äù There have been 12 nominations for the two vacancies on the WA Cricket board that opened up when chair Terry Waldron and Nicola Brandon resigned last month. WA cricket great John Inverarity, former Australian Medical Association president Michael Gannon, accountant David Brown, cricket coach and former ACB international liaison officer Alan Abraham, digital entrepreneur and community engagement expert Cam Sinclair, Cardin Langer, the director of Langer Auto Group, communication consultant Daniel Smith, former Australian diplomat Tony Sewell, Bunbury accountant John Tombleson, building practitioner Jeffrey Riley and retired JP and entreprenuer Maurice Fawcett. The two new board members will be announced at a Special General Meeting on November 21. Sign up for our emails

newsArray.title: India's tour of Bangladesh: No Sarfaraz, Vihari, Shaw as BCCI announce squads for ODIs, Tests
creator: Ishka
newsArray.description: India are set to tour Bangladesh in December 2022The tour will include three ODIs and two TestsRohit Sharma will lead India in both series
newsArray.content: India on Monday announced squads for their series against Bangladesh, which is due to take place later this year. India are set to tour Bangladesh for ODIs and Tests and Rohit Sharma is going to lead in both series with KL Rahul as his deputy. The two sides will first lock horns in the three-match ODI series, starting from Dec. 4 in Dhaka. The second and third ODI is scheduled to be played on Dec. 7 and 10. All the three games are going to be played at Dhaka's Shere Bangla National Stadium. The Test series will go underway on Dec. 14 at Zahur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium, Chattogram. The second Test will be played again in Dhaka from Dec. 22. While India are touring with mostly a full-strengthen squad with Rohit, Rahul, and Virat Kohli back, the Men in Blue have decided to rest Hardik Pandya, Suryakumar Yadav, and Dinesh Karthik for the Bangladesh tour. While DK won't be a part of both New Zealand and Bangladesh tours, Surya and Hardik have been added to India's squad for the white-ball series against the Kiwis. Ravindra Jadeja, who missed the T20 World Cup due to a knee injury, has returned to the side, while likes of Rajat Patidar and Yash Dayal have been called up to form a strong bench in the ODI format. Meanwhile, Hanuma Vihari, who was one of India's heroes in their 2020-21 Australia tour, has been dropped from the Test side. It has been reported that Chetan Sharma, the chairman of selectors, has stated that Vihari does not fit in India's combination for the Bangladesh series. India's No. 3 in Tests, Cheteshwar Pujara has retained his place in the India line-up after his fabulous comeback into the Test side after his form revival in County Cricket, while former India Test vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane continues to be away from the team. Meanwhile, Prithvi Shaw and Sarfaraz Khan have been the major absentees in the squad after their stellar domestic season. Khan finished as the leading run-scorer in the 2021-22 Ranji Trophy, scoring 982 runs in six games at an incredible average of 122.75. When asked about the duo, Sharma said that both players will get their due and the Indian selectors have been thinking about fitting both players in the team. Even Ruturaj Gaikwad has not been included in both New Zealand and Bangladesh tours. The opening batsman finished with the most runs in last season's Vijay Hazare with 603 runs in five List A games at an average of 150.75, including four hundreds. Squad for Bangladesh ODIs: Rohit Sharma (C), KL Rahul (vc), Shikhar Dhawan, Virat Kohli, Rajat Patidar, Shreyas Iyer, Rahul Tripathi, Rishabh Pant (wk), Ishan Kishan (wk), Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, W Sundar, Shardul Thakur, Mohd. Shami, Mohd. Siraj, Deepak Chahar, Yash Dayal India's ODI squad for Bangladesh tour: Rohit Sharma (c), KL Rahul (vc), Shikhar Dhawan, Virat Kohli, Rajat Patidar, Shreyas Iyer, Rahul Tripathi, Rishabh Pant (wk), Ishan Kishan (wk), Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, W Sundar, Shardul Thakur, Mohd. Shami, Mohd. Siraj, Deepak Chahar, Yash Dayal India's Test squad for Bangladesh tour: Rohit Sharma (c), KL Rahul (vc), Shubman Gill, Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant (wk), KS Bharat (wk), Ravichandran Ashwin, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Shardul Thakur, Mohd. Shami, Mohd. Siraj, Umesh Yadav.

newsArray.title: Dhawan, Hardik to lead as India announce squad for New Zealand tour
creator: Ishka
newsArray.description: India are set to tour New Zealand for a white-ball seriesThe two sides will play 3 T20Is and 3 ODIsThe series will go underway on Nov. 18 in Wellington
newsArray.content: Shikhar Dhawan and Hardik Pandya will captain India's ODI and T20I sides respectively in their upcoming tour of New Zealand.The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) on Monday announced India's squad for their limited-overs tour of New Zealand, which will take place after the T20 World Cup 2022. India are scheduled to tour New Zealand for a six-match series, including three T20Is and as many ODIs. Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and KL Rahul were rested from the New Zealand tour. Dhawan had captained India earlier this year on a tour of West Indies and Zimbabwe.With no Dinesh Karthik, Rishabh Pant was named the vice-captain and wicket-keeper for both ODI and T20I series against the BlackCaps. Rajasthan Royals (RR) pacer Kuldeep Sen earned his maiden India call-up as he was picked for the ODI series. The 26-year-old pacer has played seven List A games for Madhya Pradesh, picking up seven wickets with 3 for 30 being his best spell so far. Sen had a decent maiden Indian Premier League (IPL) season, where he picked up eight wickets in seven games for RR.While Umran Malik made a comeback after missing a few series in the last couple of months, Shahbaz Ahmed retained his place in the India side after impressing in the home series against South Africa just before the T20 World Cup went underway.The white-ball series between India and New Zealand will go underway on Nov. 18 with the first T20I at Sky Stadium, Wellington. The remaining two T20Is are going to be played on Nov. 20 and 22 at Bay Oval, Mount Maunganui, and McLean Park, Napier respectively. Following that, the focus will shift to the 50-over format with the first ODI scheduled to be played on Nov. 25 at Auckland's Eden Park. The second and third ODIs will be played on Nov. 27 and 30 at Seddon Park, Hamilton, and Hagley Oval, Christchurch respectively. India are currently competing in the T20 World Cup 2022. In the Super 12s, Rohit and Co have triumphed in two games and lost one, which was against South Africa on Sunday (Oct. 30). India's next game is on Wednesday (Nov. 2) against Bangladesh at Adelaide Oval. üö®NEWS: The All-India Senior Selection Committee has picked the squads for India's upcoming series against New Zealand and Bangladesh.‚Äî BCCI (@BCCI) October 31, 2022 India's squad for T20I series vs New Zealand: Hardik Pandya (C), Rishabh Pant (vc & wk), Shubman Gill, Ishan Kishan, Deepak Hooda, Surya Kumar Yadav, Shreyas Iyer, Sanju Samson (wk), W Sundar, Yuzvendra Chahal, Kuldeep Yadav, Arshdeep Singh, Harshal Patel, Mohd. Siraj, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Umran Malik. India's squad for ODI series vs New Zealand: Shikhar Dhawan (c), Rishabh Pant (vc), Shubman Gill, Deepak Hooda, Shreyas Iyer, Suryakumar Yadav, Sanju Samson, Yuzvendra Chahal, Kuldeep Yadav, Washington Sundar, Shahbaz Ahmed, Umran Malik, Kuldeep Sen, Arshdeep Singh, Shardul Thakur and Deepak Chahar

newsArray.title: Dewald Brevis continues to shine, takes jaw-dropping catch after scoring 162 off 57 balls; watch
creator: DNA Web Team
newsArray.description: Dewald Brevis scored the joint 3rd highest individual total in T20 cricket history after smashing 162 off 57 balls, and also took a diving catch later
newsArray.content: South African sensation Dewald Brevis can do no wrong at the moment. After smashing a sensational 162-run knock in just 57 balls, Brevis also took a stunning diving catch later in the match during the CSA T20 challenge. The Titans faced off against the Knights on Monday, and the match proved to be an epic contest, as Brevis lit up the occasion by smashing an epic knock, scoring a hundred in just 35 balls. He would go on to score the joint-third highest individual total in T20 history, and later also took a brilliant catch as Titans won by 41 runs. Brevis first stopped the ball from going out for a six, and later dived inside the playfield to complete the catch. The incident took place during the seventh over of Knights' inning. READ| Dewald Brevis aka 'Baby AB' smashes century in 35 balls, scores 162 in just 57 balls, watch video Harmer smashed a big hit trying to clear the boundary ropes, only to get dismissed by the brilliant fielding effort from the South African teenager. Watch: We‚Äôre witnessing greatness Dewald Brevis‚Äô talent knows no bounds! What a catch! #CSAT20Challenge pic.twitter.com/pbnLZVror9 ‚Äî SuperSport (@SuperSportTV) October 31, 2022 More to follow...

newsArray.title: Cricket-Titans, Knights rack up T20 world record 501 runs
newsArray.content: Best News Website or Mobile Service WAN-IFRA Digital Media Awards Worldwide Best News Website or Mobile Service Digital Media Awards Worldwide (Reuters) - South African franchises the Titans and Knights have set a new world record for the highest match aggregate of runs scored in Twenty20 cricket as they collectively bludgeoned 501 in a domestic provincial match on Monday. The Titans posted 271 for three in their 20 overs, before the Knights replied with 230 for nine on a day when the bat truly overpowered the ball at Senwes Park in Potchefstroom. The previous aggregate record of 497 was set in a game between Otago (249) and Central Districts (248) in New Zealand in 2016. Titans teenager Dewald Brevis, nicknamed "Baby AB" after former South Africa batsman AB de Villiers, smashed 162 from 57 balls with 13 fours and 13 sixes. It was the joint third highest score in the 20-over format behind Chris Gayle (175 not out) and Aaron Finch (172). There were 36 sixes struck in Potchefstroom, which is one short of the world record. Nineteen of those came in the Knights' innings.

newsArray.title: Cricket Scotland to formally investigate 22 allegations of racism after review
newsArray.description: Cricket Scotland will pursue formal investigations into 22 allegations of racist behaviour arising from a shocking independent review released earlier this year.
newsArray.content: Cricket Scotland will pursue formal investigations into 22 allegations of racist behaviour arising from a shocking independent review released earlier this year. A report into racism in Scottish cricket called 'Changing the Boundaries' was published in July, having been instigated in part by the claims of former internationals Majid Haq and Qasim Sheikh, leading to probes into 68 individual referrals. Since its release that number has risen to 77 in total, with 43 of those found to be distinct race-related issues. Almost half of those have now been sent for investigation, with a further 17 requiring additional information and four more either close to being settled or paused due to legal proceedings. Sports law firm Harper MacLeod LLP led the review process, with assistance from the charity Sporting Equals and campaigners Running Out Racism. While there is no clear timescale for the investigations, a statement for Cricket Scotland said the body was "committed to ensuring that these are conducted thoroughly and sensitively and, where appropriate, as quickly as possible". A new 'conduct in sport' panel is also being set up to deal with disciplinary matters. Interim chief executive of Cricket Scotland, Gordon Arthur, who was installed after the previous board resigned en masse immediately prior to the publication of Changing the Boundaries, said: "The report was clear in its findings and we are moving forward in making the changes required to make Scottish cricket an exemplar going forward. "However, we recognise that a more detailed investigation of a number of past issues is a critical part of the process in rebuilding trust, and redressing mistakes of the past. Only when referrals have been investigated fully, will we be able to decide what action might be taken in individual circumstances, to bring closure to those involved. Cricket Scotland appoints two new board members in wake of damning racism report Qasim Sheikh commends new Cricket Scotland partnership with South Asian Cricket Academy as 'a massive step forward' "It is important that this work is carried out sensitively and diligently and I want to express my sincere thanks to those who have raised complaints."

newsArray.title: Cricket Scotland completes initial review of complaints raised in racism probe - 22 cases require further formal investigation
creator: Gavin McCafferty
newsArray.description: Cricket Scotland has announced that all complaints raised amid the investigation into racism within Scottish cricket have now been reviewed.
newsArray.content: Following publication of the Changing The Boundaries report in July this year, the number of referrals passed to Cricket Scotland has increased to 77, relating to 43 allegations of racism against 27 different people, two clubs and two regional associations. In total there are 52 unique complaints, with nine considered to be non-race related. All 52 complaints have now been reviewed as part of an independent process being led by leading sports law firm Harper MacLeod LLP, UK-wide race equality charity Sporting Equals, and where appropriate, anti-racism campaign group Running Out Racism. Following the high-level review, Cricket Scotland has confirmed that of the 43 complaints that include allegations of racism, 22 ‚Äúrequire further formal investigation‚Äù, 17 ‚Äúneed further information to be gathered to inform next steps‚Äù, while four ‚Äúshould result in a constructive outcome or are paused due to ongoing legal process‚Äù. Advertisement ‚ÄúThis is another important step forward in terms of the referral process and we are grateful to our partners at Sporting Equals, Harper MacLeod LLP and Running Out Racism for the vital role they have played in helping us reach this stage,‚Äù said interim Cricket Scotland CEO Gordon Arthur. ‚ÄúThe report was clear in its findings and we are moving forward in making the changes required to make Scottish cricket an exemplar going forward. ‚ÄúHowever, we recognise that a more detailed investigation of a number of past issues is a critical part of the process in rebuilding trust, and redressing mistakes of the past. ‚ÄúOnly when referrals have been investigated fully, will we be able to decide what action might be taken in individual circumstances, to bring closure to those involved. Advertisement ‚ÄúIt is important that this work is carried out sensitively and diligently and I want to express my sincere thanks to those who have raised complaints. I am acutely aware of just how difficult this process has been for everyone involved. ‚ÄúWe want to see positive change in our sport and this process is central to achieving that.‚Äù Harper Macleod and Sporting Equals have started looking into the initial cases from the 22 that require to be fully investigated, as well as gathering further information on the 17 referrals which require further clarity before decisions can be taken on the next steps. While acknowledging that ‚Äúit is difficult to estimate timescales for these investigations as some will be more complex than others‚Äù, Cricket Scotland is ‚Äúcommitted to ensuring that these are conducted thoroughly and sensitively and, where appropriate, as quickly as possible‚Äù.

newsArray.title: Cricket-Rohit, Kohli and Rahul rested for NZ tour, to return for Bangladesh series
Virat Kohli Miffed at Intrusion Into His Privacy After His Hotel Room Video Surfaces
creator: Sentinel Digital Desk
newsArray.description: The video titled ‚ÄòKing Kohli‚Äôs room‚Äô shows someone filming inside Kohli‚Äôs room and panning the camera at his belongings inside the deserted room.
newsArray.content: PERTH: India's numero uno cricketer Virat Kohli on Monday said he was appalled at the video where a stranger appeared to have filmed inside his hotel room in Perth. The 33-year-old batsman took to social media to slam the invader's actions, as he surreptitiously took video footage of the batsman's room with his belongings at the Crown Perth hotel, even as India prepared for the T20 World Cup in Australia. The video titled 'King Kohli's room' shows someone filming inside Kohli's room and panning the camera at his belongings inside the deserted room. "I understand that fans get very happy and excited seeing their favourite players and get excited to meet them and I've always appreciated that," Kohli wrote to his 221 million followers on Instagram. "But this video here is appalling and it's made me feel very paranoid about my privacy. If I cannot have privacy in my own hotel room, then where can I really expect any personal space at all?? I'm NOT okay with this kind of fanaticism and absolute invasion of privacy. Please respect people's privacy and not treat them as a commodity for entertainment," said Kohli. Meanwhile, Crown Resorts has apologised for the breach at the hotel and said immediate action had been taken. The hotel said an investigation had been launched and a contractor had been "stood down". "We are aware of an incident involving a contractor and the privacy of a guest at Crown Perth," a Crown Resorts spokesperson said. "We unreservedly apologise to the guest involved and will continue to take the necessary steps to ensure this remains an isolated incident. We have zero tolerance for this behaviour, and it falls well below the standards we set for our team members and contractors. Crown took immediate steps to rectify the issue, including launching an investigation and standing down the individuals involved," the spokesperson added. The hotel authorities also said they were cooperating with the Indian Cricket team and the International Cricket Council. The original video was supposedly removed from the social media platform swiftly. The International Cricket Council said regarding the incident, "The ICC is incredibly disappointed by the gross invasion of privacy suffered by a member of the Indian travelling party at the Crown Perth, during their team's pre-event preparation ahead of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2022." Also read: SC Declares "Two-Finger Test" A Violation Of Women's Privacy And Dignity Also watch:

newsArray.title: Cricket-Afghanistan's Zazai ruled out of T20 World Cup due to injury
newsArray.content: Best News Website or Mobile Service WAN-IFRA Digital Media Awards Worldwide Best News Website or Mobile Service Digital Media Awards Worldwide (Reuters) - Afghanistan's hard-hitting opening batsman Hazratullah Zazai will miss the remainder of the Twenty20 World Cup due to an abdominal muscle strain, tournament organisers said on Monday. Zazai will be replaced by travelling reserve Gulbadin Naib in Afghanistan's 15-player squad for the tournament in Australia. Afghanistan are bottom of Group One with two points from three matches in the Super 12 stage. They lost to England and their games against New Zealand and Ireland were abandoned due to rain. Afghanistan need to beat Sri Lanka on Tuesday and Australia on Friday to have any chance of qualifying for the semi-finals.

India will play a full tour in both these countries.

newsArray.title: ENG vs NZ head to head in T20 history: England vs New Zealand T20 head to head records and stats
creator: Dixit Bhargav
newsArray.description: The 33rd match of ICC T20 World Cup 2022 will be played between England and New Zealand at the Gabba tomorrow. A high-profile clash involving leading nations will hopefully witness two Group 1 teams put on display another spectacle of a match. Only team from their group without a loss in this round, New Zealand‚Ä¶ The post ENG vs NZ head to head in T20 history: England vs New Zealand T20 head to head records and stats appeared first on The SportsRush.
newsArray.content: The 33rd match of ICC T20 World Cup 2022 will be played between England and New Zealand at the Gabba tomorrow. A high-profile clash involving leading nations will hopefully witness two Group 1 teams put on display another spectacle of a match. Only team from their group without a loss in this round, New Zealand are placed at the top of the points table and a victory will all but seal yet another semi-final berth for them. England, on the other hand, are currently at the third position on the back of winning and losing a match each. With one of their matches already getting washed out due to rain, a loss for England in Brisbane on Tuesday will all but shut the doors of qualification on them. ALSO READ: Will it rain in Brisbane tomorrow? Historically, England have had the better of the Black Caps in this format. However, the latest T20I record between these two teams has seen the Kiwis outperforming England. Played almost a year ago at the Sheikh Zayed Cricket Stadium, the last England-New Zealand T20I was a World Cup semi-final where New Zealand had managed to seal a 167-run chase with five wickets and one over to spare. ENG vs NZ head to head in T20 history Total number of matches played: 22 Matches won by ENG: 13 Matches won by NZ: 8 Matches played at a neutral venue: 6 (ENG 3, NZ 3) Matches played in ICC T20 World Cup: 6 (ENG 3, NZ 3) ENG average score against NZ: 163 NZ average score against ENG: 157 Most runs for ENG: 361 (Dawid Malan) Most runs for NZ: 471 (Martin Guptill) Most wickets for ENG: 9 (Chris Jordan) Most wickets for NZ: 16 (Mitchell Santner) Most catches for ENG: 6 (Jos Buttler and Chris Jordan) Most catches for NZ: 11 (Martin Guptill) Back in Brisbane! #T20WorldCup | #England pic.twitter.com/RCFc1qWrfi ‚Äî England Cricket (@englandcricket) October 30, 2022 NOTE: Only players part of current squads have been considered above (most runs, wickets and catches). The post ENG vs NZ head to head in T20 history: England vs New Zealand T20 head to head records and stats appeared first on The SportsRush.

newsArray.title: World of cricket: Roger Binny replaces Ganguly as BCCI president; Harmanpreet ruled out of WBBL
creator: Abhishek Mukherjee
newsArray.description: Roger Binny was elected as BCCI president on October 18 in Mumbai. His two focus areas: prevention of injuries to players, and making pitches for domestic cricket more lively.
newsArray.content: Roger Binny, the former India all-rounder and a member of the Indian team that won the 1983 World Cup, replaced Sourav Ganguly as president of the Board of Control for Cricket in India. He was elected as president on October 18 in Mumbai. Binny indicated that a focus area for his administration will be the prevention of injuries to players. ‚ÄúAs the BCCI president, I want to primarily focus on two things. First is the prevention of injuries to the players. Jasprit Bumrah got injured just before the World Cup, which affects the whole plan. Second, I want to focus on the pitches in the country... The wickets in India should be lively so when we go overseas, it helps our players,‚Äù Binny said. The rest of the BCCI office bearers are: Rajiv Shukla (vice-president), Jay Shah (secretary), Devajit Lon Saikia (joint secretary), Ashish Shelar (treasurer), Arun Singh Dhumal (chairman, IPL governing council), Avishek Dalmiya (member, IPL governing council), and Khairul Jamal Majumdar (apex council member). Georgia Redmayne and Amelia Kerr excelled with bat and ball, respectively, to lift Brisbane Heat to second place 10 days into the Women‚Äôs Big Bash League competition. Wicketkeeper-batter Redmayne made useful contributions with the bat ‚Äì including an unbeaten 98 and a 49 ‚Äì and leg-spinner Amelia Kerr backed them up with productive bowling spells, picking up seven wickets in four games. Harmanpreet Kaur, one of Melbourne Renegades‚Äô key players, was ruled out of the tournament with a back injury. Jemimah Rodrigues played just a couple of matches for her team, Melbourne Stars, but got out for a duck the only time she got a chance to bat. Smriti Mandhana opted out of WBBL to ease her workload. Read more stories on Cricket.

newsArray.title: Fuming India star Virat Kohli ‚Äòvery paranoid‚Äô after hotel worker breaks into room and films creepy video at World Cup
creator: Joshua Mbu
newsArray.content: INDIAN cricket superstar Virat Kohli was left ‚Äúvery paranoid‚Äù after a disturbing security breach saw someone sneak into his hotel room and film a video. Kohli, 33, is currently taking part in the T20 World Cup in Australia. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Virat Kohli (@virat.kohli) Instagram Hotel workers got into Kohli‚Äôs room and filmed his belongings[/caption] Instagram The India cricket star had his whole room filmed[/caption] Instagram Medicines and supplements could also be seen on the disturbing video[/caption] ReutersThe ordeal has left Kohli ‚Äòvery paranoid‚Äô[/caption] However, he now has concerns for his safety after his room at the Perth Crown hotel, as well as personal belongings, were filmed in a creepy video. The Indian cricket team stayed in the hotel for Sunday night‚Äôs clash with South Africa. It shows a close-up view of Kohli‚Äôs personal items laid out on a table next to his made hotel bed. A room tour followed before zooming in on his toiletries, medicines and supplements. READ MORE IN CRICKET JOS NOT GOOD ENOUGH Buttler fears T20 World Cup could become farce as England Australia off RACING BONUS Horse racing - Ladbrokes FREE BETS: Get ¬£20 bonus when you stake ¬£5 this week Two to three people can be seen in the video, all wearing black shoes, well-pressed grey suits and white formal shirts similar to those worn by Perth Crown hotel staff. Kohli said the disturbing footage has left him ‚Äúvery paranoid‚Äù and has called for respect of his privacy. He said on Instagram: ‚ÄúI understand that fans get very happy and excited seeing their favourite players and get excited to meet them and I‚Äôve always appreciated that. ‚ÄúBut this video here is appalling and it‚Äôs made me feel very paranoid about my privacy. Most read in Cricket JOS NOT GOOD ENOUGH Buttler fears T20 World Cup could become farce as England Australia off NET RUN RATE EXPLAINED What is net run rate in cricket and how is it calculated? WASH OUT England vs Oz becomes FOURTH T20 WC match abandoned to leave both sides in peril CRICKET CRAZY Latest updates on the ICC T20 World Cup including confirmed teams RAIN WRECK England stunned by Ireland in shock World Cup defeat as rain stops play ENGLAND VS IRELAND Chaos in Melbourne as Ireland win by 5 runs on DLS due to heavy rainfall JOIN SUN VEGAS: GET A FREE ¬£10 BONUS WITH 100s OF GAMES TO PLAY AND NO DEPOSIT REQUIRED (Ts&Cs apply) ‚ÄúIf I cannot have privacy in my own hotel room, then where can I really expect any personal space at all?? ‚ÄúI‚Äôm NOT okay with this kind of fanaticism and absolute invasion of privacy. ‚ÄúPlease respect people‚Äôs privacy and not treat them as a commodity for entertainment.‚Äù Crown Perth told Daily Mail Australia a cleaning contractor was responsible for the invasive video. The hotel has since issued an apology to superstar Kohli. A spokesperson said: ‚ÄúWe unreservedly apologise to the guest involved and will continue to take the necessary steps to ensure this remains an isolated incident.‚Äù The hotel also says the incident occurred earlier this month, when the Indian team were staying there before the start of the T20 World Cup. And those responsible no longer have access to the hotel. The hotel is continuing an investigation and working with the Indian Cricket team and the International Cricket Council.

newsArray.title: Lorcan Tucker inspirational but not enough as brave Ireland lose to Australia in crunch T20 Cricket World Cup clash
creator: Andrew Ryan
newsArray.content: DESPITE the best efforts of Lorcan Tucker, Ireland fell to a 42-run defeat to Australia in the T20 Cricket World Cup. The batsman was in sublime form, hitting a match-high 71 runs from 48 balls as he tried to salvage a result following a poor start. Ireland lost to Australia in the T20 Cricket World Cup Lorcan Tucker hit 71 runs from 48 balls in Ireland‚Äôs defeat to Australia A dreadful opening three overs saw George Dockerall, Curtis Campher, Harry Tector, Paul Stirling, and Andrew Balbirnie bowled out with a return of just 25 runs. That poor start meant the writing was on the wall and that Ireland would require a miracle to add yet another scalp to their record. Lorcan Tucker took responsibility for that task and spent the next 81 minutes racking up huge numbers. His total of 71 runs came with nine fours and a single six, and was better than any other player from either team. READ MORE ON CRICKET SAFE HANDS Watch Ireland cricket ace's INSANE save in T20 World Cup defeat to Australia IT'S A KEEPER Ireland cricket captain Andrew Balbirnie hails England T20 win as best ever Aaron Finch, who was named Player of the Match, hit 63 runs for Australia, and was the next highest scorer. The next highest scoring batsman for Ireland was Gareth Delany with just 14, indicative of their difficulties with bat in hand as they finished with 137 all-out. Ireland‚Äôs other success story came from the other side of the coin, with Barry McCarthy their principle fielder. He got three of Ireland‚Äôs five wickets against the Aussies, conceding just 29 runs against him. Most read in Cricket SAFE HANDS Watch Ireland cricket ace's INSANE save in T20 World Cup defeat to Australia GAME OFF Ireland‚Äôs T20 World Cup clash with Afghanistan CALLED OFF due to poor weather IT'S A KEEPER Ireland cricket captain Andrew Balbirnie hails England T20 win as best ever HIGH PRAISE Piers Morgan, Leo Varadkar lead tributes to Ireland after massive England win SCOT A CHANCE Ireland supporters aim hilarious chant at England during T20 World Cup win Australia finished with 179/5 from their innings, a tally that could have been worse for Ireland had it not been for the athletic prowess of McCarthy. Speaking afterwards, captain Balbirnie praised the performance of their lead batsman, but admitted that their innings got away from them. He said: ‚ÄúHard fought, it could‚Äôve got away from us. ‚ÄúWe showed fight at the end. ‚ÄúLooking at the scoreboard, we felt the score wasn‚Äôt against us, it was just the wicket column. ‚ÄúHe (Tucker) has had a good World Cup and these wickets suit him.‚Äù Mathematically-speaking, Ireland remain in with a chance to getting into the top two and qualifying for the semi-finals. Following their loss to Australia, they are in fourth-place on three points; two points before current group leaders Australia and New Zealand. Read More On The Irish Sun MY LITTLE FIGHTER Watching my little baby's fight for life inspired me, says Tyson Fury DUNNES DEAL I tried on Dunnes Stores' ‚Ç¨10 reversible jacket - it's so versatile They are level with neighbours England, whom they sensationally beat last week, although they have a game in-hand against New Zealand tomorrow. Ireland play the latter in their final group game, needing a win against all the odds.to stand a chance of qualifying

newsArray.title: India cricket star Virat Kohli 'paranoid' over hotel video
creator: The Associated Press
newsArray.description: India cricket star Virat Kohli says he is paranoid over his privacy after an "appalling" incident in which intruders allegedly filmed inside his hotel room during the Twenty20 World Cup.
newsArray.content: SYDNEY - India cricket star Virat Kohli says he is paranoid over his privacy after an "appalling" incident in which intruders allegedly filmed inside his hotel room during the Twenty20 World Cup. Kohli took to social media on Monday to denounce the video, in which a stranger walks through the room filming every step of the way. A second person was in the room when the video was shot, but no faces are shown in the footage. The video is labelled 'King Kohli's Hotel Room," and shows the star batsman's neat and organized belongings. It remains unclear in which hotel room the video was taken, or how it came into Kohli's possession. "I understand that fans get very happy and excited seeing their favorite players and get excited to meet them and I've always appreciated that," Kohli wrote to his 221 million followers on Instagram. "But this video here is appalling and it's made me feel very paranoid about my privacy. If I cannot have privacy in my own hotel room, then where can I really expect any personal space at all?? "I'm NOT okay with this kind of fanaticism and absolute invasion of privacy. Please respect people's privacy and not treat them as a commodity for entertainment." Kohli played in India's five-wicket loss to South Africa in Perth on Sunday night. The 33-year-old made only 12 runs and dropped an easy catch in the deep. India plays its next match at the T20 World Cup on Wednesday against Bangladesh in Adelaide.

newsArray.title: Massive Aussie win soured by injury concerns
creator: wwos
newsArray.description: AÔªøustralia secured a strong net run rate boost against Ireland, but may have lost its skipper for the rest of the World Cup.
newsArray.content: AÔªøustralian captain Aaron Finch 's T20 World Cup campaign could be in doubt after he suffered a hamstring injury in a thumping win over Ireland. After struggling mightily for form to start the tournament, Finch finally broke free of the shackles, smacking 63 off 44 deliveries, but pulled up lame towards the end of the knock. He was named the Player of the Match for his innings. Finch came out onto the field for the start of Ireland's innings, but was forced off due to the injury after the seventh over. Ôªø READ MORE: Cricket legend spills on 'serious' drug addiction READ MORE: Rival's furious Ricciardo spray after nasty crash READ MORE: Cup 'tactics' tipped to cruel favourite's $8m bid Tim David added to Australia's injury woes just a few overs later when he was also forced off the field with a hamstring injury. It remains to be seen what the severity of the two players' injury blows are. Adding to Australia's concerns was the fact that Marcus Stoinis also ended the match off the field. Following the match, Finch described the injury as "a little hammy twinge". "I'll get a scan tomorrow. Unfortunately I've had a history of them so we'll see how I go. It doesn't feel too bad at the moment, but generally overnight they can stiffen up. We'll get a scan and get the full results." The Australian captain said he was "very hopeful" that he would be able to take the field for the team's next match, Friday's clash against Afghanistan.Ôªø Finch's lusty blows helped Australia post an impressive total of 5-179 in its 20 overs, before early strikes from Glenn Maxwell and Mitchell Starc restricted Ireland to 137. ULTIMATE GUIDE: Everything you need to know about the 2022 Melbourne CupÔªø READ MORE: Simon O'Donnell's Melbourne Cup form guide and tips Australia needed a win of over 75 runs to see its net run rate go above England's and looked headed towards one, before a brilliant unbeaten 71 off just 48 deliveries from Ireland's Lorcan Tucker. The win sees Australia rise into second place in Group 1, behind New Zealand, but its net run rate remains in the negatives at -0.30, behind England's mark of 0.24.Ôªø For a daily dose of the best of the breaking news and exclusive content from Wide World of Sports, subscribe to our newsletter by clicking here !

newsArray.title: Cricket-Ailing Finch fifty helps Australia thrash Ireland at T20 World Cup
newsArray.content: Best News Website or Mobile Service WAN-IFRA Digital Media Awards Worldwide Best News Website or Mobile Service Digital Media Awards Worldwide MELBOURNE : Aaron Finch returned to form with a timely half-century but finished under an injury cloud as Australia eased to a 42-run win over Ireland at the T20 World Cup on Monday to keep their semi-final hopes alive. Captain Finch's 63 off 44 balls helped the champions to an imposing total of 179 for five at the Gabba before Australia's bowlers led by Mitchell Starc terrorised Ireland's top order on Halloween. Australia move to second in Group 1 behind leading New Zealand, who have a game in hand. With the top two teams advancing to the semi-finals, Australia's big win lifted their net run-rate just shy of England's, putting pressure on Jos Buttler's side to beat New Zealand at the same venue on Tuesday. After a slow and awkward 31 not out against Sri Lanka in Perth, Finch started tensely with the bat but grew in confidence in partnerships with Mitchell Marsh (28) and Marcus Stoinis (35). The stocky opener struggled with his running later in the innings, though, and left the field early with a hamstring strain during Ireland's chase. "A little hammy twinge, I think, so we'll get a scan tomorrow. Unfortunately I've had a history of them so we'll see how it goes," said Finch, named man-of-the-match. "That doesn't feel too bad at the moment but generally overnight they can stiffen up." It put a sour note on a clinical performance by the hosts in front of a crowd laden with fans dressed in Halloween costumes. After spin bowling all-rounder Glenn Maxwell took two quick wickets, Starc bowled Curtis Campher and George Dockrell in a thrilling burst of fast bowling as Ireland crashed to 25 for five at the end of the fourth over. Ireland number three Lorcan Tucker batted on and finished with a brave, unbeaten 71 but had little support from his team mates as the Irish were bowled out for 137 after 18.1 overs.

newsArray.title: T20 World Cup 2022: Australia survive Ireland's scare, keep semifinal hopes alive
newsArray.description: T20 World Cup 2022: The Australian cricket team on Monday defeated the Ireland side in their fourth match of Super 12 and moved into the second spot in Group 1. The Aaron Finch-led side got better of Andrew Balbirnie's Ireland in Brisbane by 42 runs.¬†With this win, defending champions Australia have kept their semifinal hopes alive in the tournament.
newsArray.content: The Australian cricket team on Monday defeated the Ireland side in their fourth match of Super 12 and moved into the second spot in Group 1. The -led side got better of Andrew Balbirnie's Ireland in Brisbane by 42 runs. With this win, defending champions Australia have kept their semifinal hopes alive in the tournament. Ireland won the toss and opted to bowl first. Australia lost David Warner early but their batters contributed well. Led by Aaron Finch, Australia finished at 179 in 20 overs. Finch got a brilliant 63 off 44 balls, while scored 35 off 25 balls. For Ireland, Barry McCarthy got 3 wickets, while Joshua Little scalped 2. Coming out to bat, Ireland were blown away by the Aussie bowlers. Cummins and Maxwell took the initial wickets and Ireland was soon limping at 25/5 in 4 overs. However, led by Lorcan Tucker, Ireland fought back. The wicket-keeper batter took the Aussie bowlers and spiced up things. However, with not much support, he could not do much. Australia overcame Ireland's scare and bowled them out for 137. In the end, Australia won by 42 runs. The defending champions are in the second spot behind New Zealand. They now face Afghanistan in their final match on November 4. David Warner, Aaron Finch (c), Mitchell Marsh, , Marcus Stoinis, Tim David, Matthew Wade (wk), , , Mitchell Starc, Josh Hazlewood Paul Stirling, Andrew Balbirnie (c), Lorcan Tucker (wk), Harry Tector, Curtis Campher, George Dockrell, Gareth Delany, Mark Adair, Barry McCarthy, Fionn Hand, Joshua Little

newsArray.title: AFG vs SL head to head in T20 history: Afghanistan vs Sri Lanka T20 head to head records and stats
creator: Dixit Bhargav
newsArray.description: Afghanistan and Sri Lanka will take part in ICC T20 World Cup 2022 Match 32 in Brisbane tomorrow. Both the Asian countries will face each other merely a couple of months after their intriguing Asia Cup 2022 clash at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium. The third of three Afghanistan-Sri Lanka T20Is had witnessed Sri Lanka pulling‚Ä¶ The post AFG vs SL head to head in T20 history: Afghanistan vs Sri Lanka T20 head to head records and stats appeared first on The SportsRush.
newsArray.content: Afghanistan and Sri Lanka will take part in ICC T20 World Cup 2022 Match 32 in Brisbane tomorrow. Both the Asian countries will face each other merely a couple of months after their intriguing Asia Cup 2022 clash at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium. The third of three Afghanistan-Sri Lanka T20Is had witnessed Sri Lanka pulling down a 177-run chase in the absence of a standout batting performance. However, four batters scoring in excess of 30 runs called for an archetype team effort. Reeling at the bottom of the points table in Group 1, both Sri Lanka and Afghanistan are tied at a couple of points to be at the fifth and sixth positions respectively. However, while two Sri Lankan points have come because of a victory, two points for the Afghans have come on the back of their unfortunate participation in two rain abandoned Super 12 matches. ALSO READ: Pitch report of Afghanistan vs Sri Lanka Super 12 match at the Gabba Speaking of rain, it wouldn‚Äôt be a surprise if yet another match featuring Afghanistan gets affected by the weather gods over the Gabba. For the unversed, the weather prediction for tomorrow afternoon in the city isn‚Äôt very pleasing. Penultimate match of this round for both these teams, each one of them will be keen to register victory in a full-fledged match. AFG vs SL head to head in T20 history Total number of matches played: 3 Matches won by AFG: 1 Matches won by SL: 2 Matches played at a neutral venue: 3 (AFG 1, SL 2) Matches played in ICC T20 World Cup: 1 (AFG 10, SL 1) AFG average score against SL: 145 SL average score against AFG: 146 Most runs for AFG: 124 (Rahmanullah Gurbaz) Most runs for SL: 69 (Bhanuka Rajapaksa) Most wickets for AFG: 4 (Mohammad Nabi and Mujeeb Ur Rahman) Most wickets for SL: 1 (Wanindu Hasaranga, Asitha Fernando and Maheesh Theekshana) Most catches for AFG: 3 (Rahmanullah Gurbaz) Most catches for SL: 1 (Wanindu Hasaranga, Asitha Fernando and Maheesh Theekshana) NOTE: Only players part of current squads have been considered above (most runs, wickets and catches). The post AFG vs SL head to head in T20 history: Afghanistan vs Sri Lanka T20 head to head records and stats appeared first on The SportsRush.
